chapter.title: Optional Exercise: Internationalization for the application model

section.title: Target
section.para: In this exercise you translate the relevant parts of your application model and use the translation service.

section.title: Create the translations for the application model
section.para: Create the OSGI-INF/l10n folder in your com.example.e4.rcp.todo plug-in.
Create the bundle.properties file with key/values for the parts in your application model in this folder. The file might look like the following.

Create at least one additional translation file for another language. For example, if English is your default language, create the bundle_de.properties file to provide a German translation. Ensure that the translation values are different.

section.title: Adjust the build.properties file
section.para: Add the created property files to your build.properties file in the com.example.e4.rcp.todo plug-in to make it available in an exported application.

section.title: Translate the application model
section.para: Use the defined keys with the % prefix in your application model. The following screenshot demonstrates that for a part.

section.title: Test the translation of the application model
section.para: Ensure that the application works well for the languages you provided translations for. You can set the language in your launch configuration by using the -nl start parameter as described in

warning.para: You have to change the launch configuration. Setting the language via the product file does not work, as the nl parameter is currently not correctly transferred to the launch configuration. See PDE Bug report for details.

section.title: Application model and translations
section.para: By default, it is not possible to define that the translations for the application model are located in another plug-in. If you want this, you have to implement your custom translation service.
